description:
Section 73 application for the variation of condition 2 (approved plans) of planning permission P2018/2269/FUL dated 03/07/2018 (and subsequent amendment P2019/2083/NMA) for: The demolition of the sunken play pitch (site 1), community centre and adjacent caretaker's lodge (site 2) and the construction of a new community centre [282.42 sqm GIA] (site 2) and 46 new dwellings (private and affordable) in four blocks (sites 1 and 2) ranging in height from two to six storeys and associated amenity space, bicycle parking spaces and improvements to the public realm (including to Zoffany Park, site 3). Additionally, stopping up of an area of existing highway to the north and west of Duncombe Road and land immediately west of 158-178 St Johns Way under Section 247 of the Planning Act 1990 to enable redevelopment of Site 1.
The amendments include internal alterations to various units, alterations to risers and rainwater pipes, alterations to fenestration, addition of entrance canopies, increase in size of balcony piers, increase height of parapets to Blocks A & B, reduction of garden to C1, alteration to doors, fenestration, and internal alterations to community centre, removal of bollards at junction of Buxton Road, and widening of pedestrian path south of Zoffany Park
decision_conditions:
3-YEAR PERMISSION: The development hereby permitted shall be begun not later than 30.03.2022, the expiration of three years from the date of the original permission, P2018/2269/FUL.  

REASON: To comply with the provisions of Section 91(1)(a) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 as amended by the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 (Chapter 5).
